titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3010, DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, AND EDUCATION, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2006

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 3010, DEPARTMENTS OF LABOR, HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, AND EDUCATION, AND RELATED AGENCIES APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2006; Congressional Record Vol. 151, No. 85

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Labor, Health and Human Services, Education Appropriations Act for FY 2006
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: H.R. 3010 making appropriations for the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006.<P/>Agreed to limit further amendments made in order for debate and the time limit for debate on such amendments.<P/>Fosella amendment that was offered and subsequently withdrawn that sought to eliminate the rescission of $125 million in workers' compensation and worker-retraining funds intended to aid 9/11 first responders. The amendment designated this $125 million as emergency funding.<P/>Peterson (PA) (No. 22 printed in the Congressional Record of June 22) that was offered and subsequently withdrawn that sought to increase the bill's appropriation for the Health Resources and Services Administration by $37,336,000. The amendment offsets this increase by cutting the bill's appropriation for the Occupational Safety and Health Administration by $37,336,000.<P/>Johnson (CT) amendment that was offered and subsequently withdrawn that sought to increase �D664�funds for Health Resources and Services by $11,200,000.<P/>Capuano amendment that was offered and subsequently withdrawn that sought to increase by $5,000,000 and decrease by the same amount funds for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Disease Control, Research, and Training.<P/>H. Res. 337, the rule providing for consideration of the bill was agreed to by voice vote, after agreeing to the previous question by a yea-and-nay vote of 225 yeas to 194 nays, Roll No. 304.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Labor, Health and Human Services, Education Appropriations Act for FY 2006
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: H.R. 3010 making appropriations for the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2006.<P/>Agreed to limit further amendments made in order for debate and the time limit for debate on such amendments.<P/>Obey amendment that restored $100 million for the corporation for Public Broadcasting by a recorded vote of 284 yeas to 140 nays, Roll No. 305.

congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. On this vote, the yeas are 92, the nays are 4. Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to.

The PRESIDING OFFICER. On this vote, the ayes are 69, the nays are 26. Three-fifths of the Senators, duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, the motion is rejected. The point of order fails.
